Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Carnobacteriocin BM1 (Cbn BM1, PiscV1b, natural AMPs; class 2a bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; Derivative: Carnobacteriocin B1)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: spot-on-lawn test at 50 ug/ml: Active against C. divergens LV13, C. piscicola UAL26, L. plantarum ATCC 4008, P. parvulus ATCC 19371, L. monocytogenes ATCC 15313, L. innocua ATCC 33090, E. faecium ATCC 11576 or 19434, and E. faecalis ATCC 19433.Variant: Carnobacteriocin B1 has the same amino acid sequence as carnobacteriocin BM1 with residue Met41 oxidized (sulfoxide). This oxidation reduces the activity of the peptide by a factor of 4-8. Updated 7/2021; 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: Quadri LE et al Stiles ME1994
Literature Information.Title: Chemical and genetic characterization of bacteriocins produced by Carnobacterium piscicola LV17B
